column2: If it exists, the Byzantine Empire will start with an Imperial Court.
The Byzantine Empire will §RNOT§! start with an Imperial Court.
If it exists, the Holy Roman Empire will start with an Imperial Court.
The Holy Roman Empire will §RNOT§! start with an Imperial Court.
If it exists, the Arabian Empire will start with an Imperial Court.
The Arabian Empire will §RNOT§! start with an Imperial Court.
A large chest brimming with gold and silver coins, given by [From.OriginalOwner.GetTitledFirstName] to [From.Owner.GetTitledFirstName].
Must be built by members of the Imperial Court through the §YImprove the Imperial Capital§! mission
This building trains and houses an elite corps of professional soldiers loyal only to the will of their liege.
The vast fields of the Drill Grounds are where the great armies of the realm gather to drill and prepare for war.
All great empires run on coin. This building centralises the realm's taxation bureaucracy so that they can more effectively perform their duties.
A somewhat impressive library containing knowledge gathered from all corners of the realm.
In addition to more common titles, this magnificent building houses a good number of rare and delicate texts.
The incomparable collections housed within this great library draw scholars from all across the known world.
Located close to the [FromFrom.Holder.GetTitle]'s residence, these corridors of power are filled with the sounds of bickering elites and functionaries jostling for position at court.
A large palace constructed for the [FromFrom.Holder.GetTitle] to serve as the administrative seat of power in the empire.
The jewel of the empire, this building is vast, beautiful, and very impressive, and serves as the realm's seat of power.
Prefering an administrative role to a military one, this character excels at keeping the wheels of empire turning.
This character excels at politicking - whether in service of the realm or to raise their dynasty's status at court.
This character is a renowned commander of the empire whose military skill earns them fame at court - and plenty of rivals.
if you see this please report it on the Imperial Courts mod page

Influential members of the imperial court seek to remove §Y[From.Liege.GetBestName]§! from power and replace [From.Liege.GetHerHim] with one of their own. Once this faction is sufficiently powerful, §Y[From.GetBestName]§! may present an ultimatum to §Y[From.Liege.GetBestName]§!.
$ORDER$Imperial Court war to oust $DEFENDER$ from Power
The time has come for the court to take control of [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetName]!
The time has come for glory!
The Imperial Court will send you aid.
You will be able to pick a dynasty member to hold the duchy if you succeed.

The Imperial Court is functional but has no real influence over the realm. Most of the power is in the [Root.GetTitle]'s hands.

§Y*§! The [Root.GetTitle] may freely introduce [Root.GetHerHis] children to the court.[Root.GetCanMoveCourt]
§Y*§! Vassals cannot refuse an order to relinquish non-dejure titles from the [Root.GetTitle].
§Y*§! Following an Imperial Conquest, all conquered titles go to the [Root.GetTitle].

The Imperial Court is growing in influence but the [Root.GetTitle]'s power is still strong.

§Y*§! The [Root.GetTitle] may freely introduce [Root.GetHerHis] children to the court.[Root.GetCanMoveCourt]
§Y*§! Vassals cannot refuse an order to relinquish non-dejure titles from the [Root.GetTitle].
§Y*§! Following an Imperial Conquest, all conquered titles go to the [Root.GetTitle].

The Imperial Court has become influential enough that the [Root.GetTitle] has diverted some resources to contain the threat.

§Y*§! The [Root.GetTitle] may freely introduce [Root.GetHerHis] children to the court.[Root.GetCanMoveCourt]
§Y*§! Vassals may §Rrebel§! when ordered to relinquish non-dejure titles by the [Root.GetTitle].
§Y*§! Following an Imperial Conquest, all conquered titles get divided amongst the most influential participants.
§Y*§! Viceroys may use the §YMake Viceroyalty Hereditary power§!.

The Imperial Court holds enough power to withhold some of their taxes and levies forcing the [Root.GetTitle] to rely on personal resources.

§Y*§! The [Root.GetTitle] §Rcannot§! introduce [Root.GetHerHis] children to the court.[Root.GetCanMoveCourt]
§Y*§! Vassals may §Rrebel§! when ordered to relinquish non-de jure titles by the [Root.GetTitle].
§Y*§! Following an Imperial Conquest, all conquered titles get divided amongst the most influential participants.
§Y*§! Viceroys may use the §YMake Viceroyalty Hereditary power§!.
§Y*§! The most influential member of the court will §Rrecieve a claim on the empire§! after succession.

The court has become the true power in the realm. Unless its power is checked, it will eventually overthrow the [Root.GetTitle].

§Y*§! The [Root.GetTitle] §Rcannot§! introduce [Root.GetHerHis] children to the court.[Root.GetCanMoveCourt]
§Y*§! Vassals may §Rrebel§! when ordered to relinquish non-dejure titles by the [Root.GetTitle].
§Y*§! Following an Imperial Conquest, all conquered titles get divided amongst the most influential participants.
§Y*§! Viceroys may use the §YMake Viceroyalty Hereditary power§!.
§Y*§! The most influential member of the court will §Rrecieve a claim on the empire§! after succession.
§Y*§! §RMembers of the court may start a faction to initiate a coup!§!
\n§Y*§! The Imperial Court can be moved when a new empire is obtained.
\n§Y*§! The Imperial Court §Rcannot§! be moved when a new empire is obtained.

[Root.GetBestName] has led the armies of the [champion_realm.GetFullBaseName] to victory against [champion_enemy.GetTitledName], earning [Root.GetHerHim] the admiration and awe of the people of [champion_realm.GetName].
This [Root.GetTitle] has refused a request from the court, which has upset many vassals.
if you see this please report it on the Imperial Courts mod page
An Imperial Road has been constructed in this province.
Peasants busy building an Imperial Road
The peasants of this province are disgruntled by having to build an Imperial Road in another province.
The soldiers of this provice are busy patroling a newly built Imperial Road in another province.
The soldiers of this provice are busy patroling a newly built Imperial Road in another province.
This province's ruler and [This.Holder.GetHerHis] soldiers have participated in a military drill at the capital.
The ruler of this province has pledged troops to the ongoing Imperial Conquest.
The peasants of this province have recently enjoyed themselves at a nearby festival.
The [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitle] has conscripted most of the soldiers stationed here.
The imperial capital is recieving an influx of recruits due to the [Root.Holder.GetTitle]'s recent mass conscription.

§Y*§! §YMission:§! Build Imperial Road, can be assigned by §Gright-clicking§! on a county's title shield.
§Y*§! §YMission:§! Improve Imperial Capital, can be assigned by §Gright-clicking§! on your own portrait.
§Y*§! §YMission:§! Organize Military Drill, can be assigned by §Gright-clicking§! on on your own portrait.
§Y*§! §YMission:§! Distribute Levy Recompense, can be assigned by §Gright-clicking§! on your own portrait.
§Y*§! §YMission:§! Imperial Conquest, can be assigned by §Gright-clicking§! on a foreign non-titular duchy title.
§Y*§! §YMission:§! Convert to Liege Culture, can be assigned by §Gright-clicking§! on a vassal's portrait.
§Y*§! §YMission:§! Organize Festival, can be assigned by §Gright-clicking§! on your own portrait.
§Y*§! §YMission:§! Investigate Secret Cults, can be assigned by §Gright-clicking§! on your own portrait.
§Y*§! §YMission:§! Infiltrate Court, can be assigned by §Gright-clicking§! on a foreign independent ruler.
\n§Y*§! Can assign and revoke §MImperial Offices§! to rank 3 members by §Gright-clicking§! on their portraits

§Y*§! §YPower:§! Levy Extra Tax
§Y*§! §YMission:§! Build Imperial Road, can be assigned by §Gright-clicking§! on a county's title shield.
§Y*§! §YMission:§! Improve the Imperial Capital, can be assigned by §Gright-clicking§! on your own portrait.

§Y*§! §YPower:§! Invite Imperial Commander
§Y*§! §YMission:§! Organize Military Drill, can be assigned by §Gright-clicking§! on on your own portrait.
§Y*§! §YMission:§! Distribute Levy Recompense, can be assigned by §Gright-clicking§! on your own portrait.
§Y*§! §YMission:§! Imperial Conquest, can be assigned by §Gright-clicking§! on a foreign non-titular duchy title.

§Y*§! §YPower:§! Order to Leave Factions, can be accessed by §Gright-clicking§! on the portrait of a vassal in your realm.
§Y*§! §YMission:§! Convert to Liege Culture, can be assigned by §Gright-clicking§! on a vassal's portrait.
§Y*§! §YMission:§! Organize Festival, can be assigned by §Gright-clicking§! on your own portrait.

§Y*§! §YPower:§! Declare Traitor, can be accessed by §Gright-clicking§! on the portrait of a vassal in your realm.
§Y*§! §YMission:§! Investigate Secret Cults, can be assigned by §Gright-clicking§! on your own portrait.
§Y*§! §YMission:§! Infiltrate Court, can be assigned by §Gright-clicking§! on a foreign independent ruler.
As this character keeps issuing successful missions, [Root.GetSheHe] becomes more adept at choosing the correct person for the job.

Is a member of the Imperial Court
Is a member of a Christian Imperial Court
Is a member of a Muslim Imperial Court
Is a member of a Pagan Imperial Court
Is a member of an Eastern Imperial Court
Is a member of an Unique Imperial Court
Either a §YParent§! or a §YSpouse§! is the §Y[Root.TopLiege.GetTitle]§!
Is the heir to a landed title
Has a claim of at least §YDuchy§! rank
Has NOT been castrated or blinded by the current §Y[Root.TopLiege.GetTitle]§!
The current §Y[Root.TopLiege.GetTitle]§! must revoke the §MImperial Office§! of [Root.TopLiege.GetImperialRegentAssignableOffice] to join
Has been castrated or blinded by the current §YBasileus§! or §YBasilissa§!
Has NOT been castrated or blinded by the current §YBasileus§! or §YBasilissa§!
Has been castrated or blinded by the current §YAugustus§! or §YAugusta§!
Has NOT been castrated or blinded by the current §YAugustus§! or §YAugusta§!
Has NOT recently completed or declined a mission
Is NOT in revolt against the empire
Other members of the Imperial Court are irritated
Other members of the Imperial Court are displeased
Other members of the Imperial Court are greatly displeased
Other members of the Imperial Court are outraged
Is granted the Imperial Office of [This.TopLiege.GetImperialRegentAssignableOffice]
Will no longer hold the Imperial Office of [This.TopLiege.GetImperialRegentAssignableOffice]
You will take direct control of the Imperial Court
Is granted the Imperial Office of [This.TopLiege.GetImperialSeneschalAssignableOffice]
Will no longer hold the Imperial Office of [This.TopLiege.GetImperialSeneschalAssignableOffice]
Is granted the Imperial Office of [This.TopLiege.GetImperialMarshalAssignableOffice]
Will no longer hold the Imperial Office of [This.TopLiege.GetImperialMarshalAssignableOffice]

Will no longer hold the Imperial Office of [This.TopLiege.GetImperialSpymasterAssignableOffice]
Fixes a bug with leaderless special Imperial Courts

By establishing an Imperial Court you will introduce your realm to a whole new administrative system. The more power you give away, the higher the benefits - but the more dangerous realm politics become. Balance must be maintained.
No Powerful Vassal has a negative opinion of you
An Imperial Court will be established

By establishing an Imperial Court you will introduce your realm to a whole new administrative system. The more power you give away, the higher the benefits - but the more dangerous realm politics become. Balance must be maintained.
Establish the Holy Roman Imperial Court

By establishing an Imperial Court you will introduce your realm to a whole new administrative system. The more power you give away, the higher the benefits - but the more dangerous realm politics become. Balance must be maintained.

By establishing an Imperial Court you will introduce your realm to a whole new administrative system. The more power you give away, the higher the benefits - but the more dangerous realm politics become. Balance must be maintained.

By establishing an Imperial Court you will introduce your realm to a whole new administrative system. The more power you give away, the higher the benefits - but the more dangerous realm politics become. Balance must be maintained.
Form the Holy Roman Empire and Imperial Court

With a realm to rival that of Charlemagne, I could be recognized as his true successor and, invoking Translatio Imperii, have [Root.RelHead.GetBestName] crown me Emperor of a new Roman Empire in the west!\n§RIf you don't use this decision instead of the regular "Form the Holy Roman Empire" decision, your game may break!§!
Found the Holy Roman Empire and Imperial Court

Is it not every [Root.GetTitle]'s dream to be recognized as the true successor to the Caesars? I can invoke the translatio imperii and have [Root.RelHead.GetBestName] crown me as ruler of a new Roman Empire in the west!\n§RIf you don't use this decision instead of the regular "Found the Holy Roman Empire" decision, your game may break!§!
Restore the Roman Empire and the Roman Imperial Court

If Rome and other key territories of the old empire could be reclaimed, the Byzantine Empire would win recognition in the eyes of the West as the true and rightful continuation of the Roman State.\n§RIf you don't use this decision instead of the regular "Restore the Roman Empire" decision, your game may break!§!
Restore Byzantium and the Byzantine Imperial Court
I will gather the crown lands of Byzantium, and raise the old banners of Rome once more.\n§RIf you don't use this decision instead of the regular "Restore Byzantium" decision, your game may break!§!
Adopt Chinese Imperialism and move the Court

Adopt a system of Chinese Imperialism which has one divine Emperor ruling over multiple vassals in a system of regulations and bureaucracy.\n§RIf you don't use this decision instead of the regular "Adopt Chinese Imperialism" decision, your game may break!§!
Form the Slavic Union and move the Court

Ancestral legends tell of a time when the three brothers, Lech, Czech, and Rus, went their own way to find fertile lands for their people. Today, countless generations later, all the children of this same ancestral blood are united under my rule, so it is only fit that we rid ourselves of our old and petty borders and formally establish one land in which all slavs will be as brothers and sisters.\n§RIf you don't use this decision instead of the regular "Form the Slavic Union" decision, your game may break!§!
Form an Empire of the Outremer and move the Court

I will not stop until the dream of reconquering everything that was once Christian has been fulfilled. I will make sure the Holy Land stays safe and Christian to the end of times.\n§RIf you don't use this decision instead of the regular "Form an Empire of the Outremer" decision, your game may break!§!
Create the Empire of Russia and move the Court

Holding the Empire of Rus is not enough – some are starting to think that 'the Empire of Russia' has a better ring to it...\n§RIf you don't use this decision instead of the regular "Create the Empire of Russia" decision, your game may break!§!
The Imperial Court served its purpose, for a time. But the power plays of my subjects have caused more harm than good.  It is time for power to return to where it belongs.
Your current capital is not considered to be the Imperial Capital of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. This should be remedied.
The current Imperial Capital is NOT targeted by any mission
[Root.Capital.GetName] becomes the new Imperial Capital.\nAll Imperial buildings will be transferred
You are in control of the empire but not its current Imperial Capital. As [Root.GetTitle] it is yours by right.
NOT in control of the Imperial Capital
The court is growing strong. One way to reduce some of its influence is to take control of some of your vassals' levies. This will of course make most of them rather unhappy...
Have NOT taken conscripts in the last decade[Root.GetIpcConscriptCooldown]
The Imperial Court's influence will be reduced!
As [From.GetTitle] your children can easily join the Imperial Court. [Root.GetFirstName] will also be immediately promoted to the second rank.
By using some of your influence, you are able to bypass some of the usual requirements and secure a position at court for [Root.GetFirstName].
Due to your rank and influence at the Imperial Court, you are able to force [Root.GetBestName] to owe you a favor.
As [Root.GetImperialLawkeeperAssignableOffice] of [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetName], you are able to command [Root.GetBestName] to leave all factions.
[Root.GetBestName] will leave all factions and will not be able to join any for some time.
Using your influence as [This.GetImperialSpymasterAssignableOffice] you are able to accuse [Root.GetBestName] of treason.
Have NOT recently declared a traitor[Root.GetIpcTraitorCooldown]
Will give [Root.GetFirstName]'s liege just cause to imprison [Root.GetHerHim].
[Root.GetBestName] has titles within [Root.GetHerHis] realm that are not rightfully [Root.GetHersHis]. Order [Root.GetHerHim] to release all such lands and vassals to their de jure lieges.
Has titles that are NOT de jure of §Y[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]§!
You are NOT currently waiting for a response from [Root.GetFirstName]
Since the Imperial Court's influence is high enough, [Root.GetFirstName] might rebel against this demand
[Root.GetFirstName] will release all lands and vassals of which [Root.GetSheHe] is not the §Yde jure§! liege.
Must be a direct vassal of the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle]
Is an unlanded close relative of the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle]
Must have been at the §Y[Root.GetSocietyRank]§! rank for at least five years
Donate Funds to the Imperial Court
By donating some funds to the Imperial Court you will be able to obtain some §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§!. The higher your ranking at court, the less effective this is.
Have NOT recently donated to the Imperial Court[Root.GetIpcDonateCooldown]
The Imperial Capital is a bustling metropolis where fortunes can be made - and broken. Why not spend some time exploring the city?
Have NOT recently visited the Imperial Capital[Root.GetIpcCapitalCooldown]
By using a considerable amount of your influence, you will be able to turn one of your ducal viceroyalties into a hereditary one.
Having obtained a high rank at court, you might find it worthwhile to focus on one area of expertise.
As [This.GetImperialSeneschalAssignableOffice], you may use some of your influence to levy an extra tax from your demesne.
Have NOT recently taken extra taxes[Root.GetIpcTaxCooldown]
Due to your status as [This.GetImperialMarshalAssignableOffice], you are able to invite a commander from the Imperial Army to serve you personally.
Have NOT recently invited an Imperial Commander[Root.GetIpcCommanderCooldown]

Present an ultimatum to §Y[Root.Liege.GetBestName]§!, demanding that [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] abdicates in favor of the most influential member of the Imperial Court. If [Root.Liege.GetSubjectPronoun] refuses to comply, your Faction will rise in revolt.
Adds a modifier that shows all missions you could potentially assign.
Having an Imperial Road in the province would make travel easier and improve trade.
A neighboring province has an Imperial Road
A road is NOT already under construction in the province
Is the owner of the province
As the center of the empire, the Imperial Capital must be prosperous. The assigned character will work to increase the progress of court construction projects in the capital.
A member of the Imperial Court is NOT already assigned this mission
All possible buildings are NOT already built in the Imperial Capital
This will have various effects on all Lords and Commanders that attend the Military Drill. The strength of these effects depend on the assigned character's abilities.
A military drill is NOT already being organized
The empire is at war, and the elites are irritated at having to pay upkeep for their levies. Let the empire compensate these nobles, and renew their loyalty!
At least §Y5§! direct vassals of the §Y[Root.TopLiege.GetTitle]§! are upset about raised levies
The empire must grow! Order a vassal to conquer a duchy with aid from the Imperial Court.
There is NOT an ongoing Imperial Conquest
Is likely to gain support from fellow members
Is very likely to gain support from fellow members
Is extremely likely to gain support from fellow members

[Root.GetBestName]'s culture differs from [Root.TopLiege.GetBestName], which is a cause of unneccessary conflict within the realm. Perhaps a member of the Imperial Court can convince [Root.GetHerHim] to adopt our ways and in turn, [Root.GetSheHe] might also win over [Root.GetHerHis] heir.
As any ruler knows, a disgruntled peasant can easily spark rebellion. By assigning someone to organize a festival, the peasants will be able to forget their woes for a time.
There is a risk of a revolt in the empire
There is NOT an ongoing festival

Many people claim to confess the one true faith, but the realm must be constantly vigilant lest corruption and heresy enter the hearts of the populace. Launch an empire wide investigation to root out secret cults.
An investigation is NOT already in progress
Send a member of the court to plant an agent in [Root.GetFirstName]'s court, making plots easier against [Root.GetFirstName] and [Root.GetHerHis] courtiers.
Is NOT already targeted by this mission
An Imperial Court infiltrator is NOT already present
If you see this please report it on the Imperial Courts mod page
If you see this please report it on the Imperial Courts mod page
If you see this please report it on the Imperial Courts mod page
[Root.GetBestName] is currently overseeing court life. But perhaps it is time for someone else to take on these duties.
[Root.GetBestName] currently holds high office at court. But perhaps it is time to relieve [Root.GetHerHim] of these duties.

By granting the Imperial Office of [Root.TopLiege.GetImperialSeneschalAssignableOffice] to [Root.GetBestName], [Root.GetSheHe] will be responsible for handling the finances and economic growth of the realm. This would make it easier for you to focus on other tasks.

By granting the Imperial Office of [Root.TopLiege.GetImperialMarshalAssignableOffice] to [Root.GetBestName], [Root.GetSheHe] will be responsible for commanding and maintaining the realm's armies. This would make it easier for you to focus on other tasks.

By granting the Imperial Office of [Root.TopLiege.GetImperialLawkeeperAssignableOffice] to [Root.GetBestName], [Root.GetSheHe] will act as intermediary between you and your subjects. This would make it easier for you to focus on other tasks.

By granting the Imperial Office of [Root.TopLiege.GetImperialSpymasterAssignableOffice] to [Root.GetBestName], [Root.GetSheHe] will be responsible for the realm's more subtle affairs. This would make it easier for you to focus on other tasks.
